data.prayer: Father, please make every disciple be a disciple maker, every home a training center, and every church a church planting movement in the state of Louth.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Louth, Ireland
data.section_summary: What conditions of religion or environment could you pray for here?

data.prayer: Lord, there are 115,819 people in the state of Louth who claim Christianity, but may have never read the Bible. Please challenge them today to read the Bible for themselves.
data.verse: All Scripture is God-breathed and is useful for teaching, rebuking, correcting and training in righteousness

data.label_1: One disciple of Jesus for every 64 lost neighbors

data.prayer: Lord, cause a passion for prayer among the people of Louth, Ireland.
data.verse: I [Jesus] pray also for those who will believe in me through their message, that all of them may be one, Father, just as you are in me and I am in you. May they also be in us so that the world may believe that you have sent me.

data.prayer: Father, encourage the 2,004 believers in Louth to not just be consumers of knowledge but be producers of love, mercy, kindness, and justice.
data.verse: let us not love with words or speech but with actions and in truth.

data.prayer: Father, look after and teach the way that is best for the 2,004 believers living in Louth, Ireland.
data.verse: I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go. I will counsel you with my loving eye on you.

data.prayer: Spirit, defend the church in the state of Louth against being inward-focused.
data.verse: The Spirit of the Sovereign LORD is on me, because the LORD has anointed me to proclaim good news to the poor. He has sent me to bind up the brokenhearted, to proclaim freedom for the captives and release from darkness for the prisoners.

data.prayer: Father, like with the Ethiopian Eunuch, set up a meeting today between a faithful believer in Louth, Ireland and a person seeking to understand the truth.
data.verse: The eunuch asked Philip, “Tell me, please, who is the prophet talking about, himself or someone else?” Then Philip began with that very passage of Scripture and told him the good news about Jesus.
